name: adjournment
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a pause or rest during a formal meeting or trial, or the act of giving a pause or rest: The defence attorney requested an adjournment. The court's adjournment means that a decision will not be reached until December at the earliest. See
adjourn
More examplesFewer examplesHe would be seeking an adjournment to prepare his client's defence. An adjournment was granted to enable Mr. Smith to consider his position.A court may request an adjournment so that reports on the defendant may be obtained before passing sentence.

the temporary ending of a meeting or trial, or the period of time during which it is temporarily ended: This trial has a history of delays and repeated adjournments. The judge granted the request for an adjournment. The Senate passed the bill, but the House didn't vote on it before adjournment.
